newsitem.title: USA: US CREDIT OUTLOOK - Durable goods, indexed bond sale.
newsitem.headline: US CREDIT OUTLOOK - Durable goods, indexed bond sale.

text.p: The debut of inflation-indexed U.S. bonds and data on December's durable goods orders should garner the attention of bond market participants on Wednesday.
But a selloff from lofty levels in both stocks and bonds late Tuesday had some economists doubting that much forward momentum could be sustained Wednesday.

"The employment cost index provided some relief, but we still have the same basic economic scenario. ... growth and tight labor markets and the risks are to the upside," said Michael Moran, chief economist at Daiwa Securities America Inc.

Durable goods orders were scheduled for release at 830 EST/1330 GMT. Consensus estimates had December orders increasing by 1.2, and excluding defense orders rising by 2.2 percent. In November, both figures declined, by 1.6 percent and 3.4 percent respectively.
Treasury will hold its first sale of $7.0 billion of inflation-indexed securities Wednesday at 1300EST/1800 GMT. Moran looked forward to the sale.
"A lot of firms and traders don't know where to bid on these securities and that should make for an interesting learning experience," Moran said.
